problems.title: Assign Cookies to Children
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You have N children and M cookies.
Each child i has a greed factor g[i] - the minimum cookie size that will satisfy them.
Each cookie j has a size s[j].

A cookie can be given to a child only if its size is >= the child's greed factor.
Each child can get at most one cookie, and each cookie can be given to at most one child.

Find the maximum number of children you can satisfy.

Use Greedy: Try to satisfy each child with the smallest possible cookie that works!
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3
1 2 3
3
1 1 3

Sample Output
2

Explanation:
Children greed factors: [1, 2, 3]
Cookie sizes: [1, 1, 3]

Sorted children: [1, 2, 3]
Sorted cookies: [1, 1, 3]

- Child with greed 1: Give cookie of size 1
- Child with greed 2: Cookie of size 1 < 2, skip. Cookie of size 3 >= 2
- Child with greed 3: No cookies left

Total satisfied = 2

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n = int(data[0])
    greed = list(map(int, data[1].split()))
    m = int(data[2])
    cookies = list(map(int, data[3].split()))
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.findContentChildren(greed, cookies))

hintsList: Sort both children (by greed) and cookies (by size) in ascending order.
Use two pointers: try to match the least greedy child with the smallest suitable cookie.
